Entities.Name: Anatomical Entity
Entities.Definition: Entities corresponding to anatomical parts, such as 'breast' (pecho), 'liver' (hígado), 'right thyroid lobe' (lóbulo tiroideo derecho).

Sample Data.Sentence: Liver enlarged by 3 cm, consistent with patient's diagnosed condition.

Entities.Name: Finding
Entities.Definition: Pathological findings or diagnoses, such as 'cyst' or 'cyanosis'.

Sample Data.Sentence: Ultrasound revealed a small cyst on the liver.

Entities.Name: Location
Entities.Definition: Refers to a location in the body where findings are observed, such as 'walls', 'cavity'.

Sample Data.Sentence: Inflammation observed on the inner cavity walls.

Entities.Name: Measure
Entities.Definition: Expressions indicating measurements related to medical conditions or findings.

Entities.Name: Type of Measure
Entities.Definition: Specifies the type of measurement taken, like temperature or pressure.

Entities.Name: Degree
Entities.Definition: Indicates the degree of a finding or severity, such as 'mild', 'moderate', 'severe'.

Sample Data.Sentence: Patient shows mild symptoms of dehydration.

Entities.Name: Abbreviation
Entities.Definition: Acronyms or abbreviations that indicate medical concepts, used commonly within the clinical context.

Entities.Name: Negation
Entities.Definition: Indicates negation in medical findings, altering the interpretation of the diagnosis.

Entities.Name: Uncertainty
Entities.Definition: Indicates uncertainty or probability concerning a medical finding or diagnosis.

Entities.Name: Conditional Temporal
Entities.Definition: Indicates a temporal condition that either has occurred in the past or may occur in the future.

Sample Data.Sentence: If fever persists, further tests will be necessary.

Dataset.Name: SpRadIe 2021 Dataset
Dataset.Details: Contains 513 ultrasonography reports from a pediatric hospital in Argentina, annotated for NER tasks.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Guidelines detail how to identify and annotate various medical entities, provided in two rounds of annotations by clinical experts and linguists.
